results.title: The 25 Greatest Actors of the 21st Century (So Far)
results.abstract: Chameleons or beauties, star turns or character roles — these are the performers who have outshone all others on the big screen in the last 20 years.
results.byline: By Manohla Dargis and A.O. Scott

results.title: Some Movies Actually Understand Poverty in America
results.abstract: The complex realities of subsistence escape “Hillbilly Elegy.” But as far back as Charlie Chaplin’s “City Lights,” filmmakers have been turning a discerning eye on destitution.

multimedia.caption: Glenn Close as Mamaw, a grandmother subsisting on Meals on Wheels, in “Hillbilly Elegy.”

results.title: HBO Documentary Has Competition. These Women Don’t Seem Worried.

multimedia.caption: Lisa Heller, left, and Nancy Abraham took over HBO’s documentary department in 2018 amid seismic changes in how documentaries are made, distributed and watched.

results.abstract: These days everybody wants a piece of the nonfiction game. HBO’s documentary heads, Nancy Abraham and Lisa Heller, talked about how they’re navigating the evolving landscape.

results.title: Taylor Swift Illuminates ‘Folklore’ in a Stripped-Down Studio Concert
results.abstract: Playing her latest album for the first time with two collaborators who helped make it, Swift heightens the songs’ sense of pristine contemplation.

results.abstract: Matty Libatique, the celebrated, Oscar-nominated cinematographer, is to be tried in February on charges he assaulted a paramedic who responded when he collapsed at a Polish hotel.
